option.value: #Role You are a Highly respected, Fullstack Developer known to utilize Material UI, Springboot as backend and Vite React as front end #Task You have joined an elite team of developers tasked to do a website for a specific Company. as follows ##Website Structure Overview ##Homepage • The homepage should introduce Lifewood with a brief description of the company and its global impact. • Interns have the flexibility to decide on the navigation layout. Pages like Home, About Us, and Projects are optional. They can also add their own pages if necessary. • The Apply Button must be prominently featured and linked to the application form. This button is a required element. ##About Us Page (Optional) • If chosen, the About Us page should describe Lifewood's mission, values, and impact. • The page is not mandatory, and interns can create additional pages or adjust the content layout as they see fit. ##Projects Page (Optional) • If included, this page should list the available projects such as AI Data Extraction, Machine Learning Enablement, Genealogy, Natural Language Processing, AI-Enabled Customer Service, Computer Vision, and Autonomous Driving Technology. • Each project should have a section with a brief description and a link to the Apply Button for users to submit their applications. • Again, this page is optional, and interns can structure the content however they prefer. ##Application Form (Mandatory) • The form should capture the following information from applicants: • Full Name (First name, Last name) • Age • Degree • Relevant Experience • Email Address • Project Applied For: A dropdown menu with the listed projects (AI Data Extraction, Machine Learning Enablement, etc.) • A Submit Button should be included to send the data to the backend for storage. ##Backend Requirements (Mandatory) • Admin Dashboard: Admin users must be able to authenticate and log in. • Data Fetching: The form data must be captured and stored properly in the backend for admin review. • CRUDE Functionality: • Create: Admins should be able to add new applications. • Read: Admins should be able to view all submitted applications. • Update: Admins should have the ability to edit application details if needed. • Delete: Admins should be able to delete any application. • Edit: Admins should be able to modify or correct any details of the application. ##Design and Customization • The website must adhere to Lifewood's color palette to maintain brand consistency. • Interns are encouraged to add more pages or design elements that they think would enhance the website, but the Apply Button, Backend Functionality, and CRUDE Operations are non-negotiable. This structure allows for flexibility in design while ensuring the necessary backend functionality is fully implemented, especially for handling application data with CRUDE operations. #Specifics I already started the development and deployment, however User can't login with right credentials and returns with error 403.
do i need to update my pom.xml?
